sense.gloss: fraud, swindle, graft, cheating, trick, scam
saying you're going to do something but in the end not doing it, making promises without keeping them

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑潔↑↓い|さぎ|よ↓く↑辞任↑↓じにん↓すべきだ。
sdata.e: You should do the honorable thing and resign.

sdata.e: In our society we find men of integrity along with crooks.

sdata.e: Mr Tom Jones has agreed to serve as the project leader for this new work item.

sdata.e: Tell me what makes you so depressed.

sdata.e: I'm ready to admit that it was my fault.

sdata.e: The old woman fell an easy prey to the fraud.

sdata.e: The soldier disdained shooting an unarmed enemy.

sdata.e: The factory will cease operations next month.

sdata.j: その↑計画↑↓けいかく↓は↑実↑↓じつ↓にうまく↑考↑↓かんが↓えた↑詐欺↑↓|さぎ|↓だった。
sdata.e: The plan was a masterpiece of fraud.

sdata.j: そして、その↑小↑↓ちい↓さなウ|サギ|の↑二人↑↓ふたり↓は↑大↑↓おお↓きな↑森↑↓もり↓の↑中↑↓なか↓でいっしょに↑幸↑↓しあわ↓せに↑暮↑↓くら↓して、たんぽぽを↑食↑↓た↓べたり、ひなぎくを↑飛↑↓と↓んだりクローバーを↑通↑↓とお↓りぬけたりオークの↑実↑↓み↓を↑探↑↓さが↓したりして↑長↑↓なが↓い↑間↑↓あいだ↓↑暮↑↓く↓らしました。
sdata.e: And so the two little rabbits lived together happily in the big forest; eating dandelions, playing Jump The Daisies, Run Through The Clover and Find The Acorn all day long.

sdata.e: The confidence man and his blonde call girl make a perfect match in enraging his landlady.

sdata.j: ↑二兎↑↓にと↓を↑追↑↓お↓うものは↑一↑↓いち↓↑兎↑↓う|さぎ|↓をも↑得↑↓え↓ず。
sdata.e: If you run after two hares, you will catch neither.
